title: Director Tour for Members
brief_description: Join Art Museum Director Stuart Horodner for a 'Members-Only Directors Tour' addressing the importance of diversity in exhibition-making
description:
Join Art Museum Director Stuart Horodner for a 'Members-Only Directors Tour' addressing the importance of diversity in exhibition-making, and connections between art and activism. Horodner has a long and distinguished career as a curator working with prominent artists of color, including Mel Edwards, Simone Leigh, Clifford Owens, William Pope.L, and Jack Whitten, among others. Not a member? Join today athttp://finearts.uky.edu/art-museum/members

Prior to coming to UK, Horodner held positions as artistic director of the Atlanta Contemporary Art Center; visual arts curator at the Portland Institute for Contemporary Art, Portland, OR (2001-2004); director of the Bucknell University Art Gallery, Lewisburg, PA (1998-2001); and was co-owner of the Horodner Romley Gallery, New York, NY (1992-1996). He has contributed to journals and magazines, including Art Issues, Art Lies, Art on Paper, Bomb, Dazed & Confused, Sculpture and Surface. He received his BFA from The Cooper Union, New York, NY, and his MFA from the Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University, New Brunswick, NJ.

title: Senses of Place: VR | Performance of "Virtual Realities"
brief_description: "Virtual Realities" by Dima Strakovsky and Richie Hoagland is at once a performance, an installation and a product demo
description:
"Virtual Realities" by Dima Strakovsky and Richie Hoagland

“Virtual Realities” is at once a performance, an installation and a product demo. It explores the transformation of parent/child relationships brought about by the changes in contemporary technologies. Gallery visitors are an audience for a 15-minute performance followed by a 30-minute open discussion of the project.

title: Opening Reception: You Are Here Now
brief_description: You Are Here Now is an interactive photographic documentation of the personal histories of individuals living in the East and North Ends of Lexington, KY.
description:
You Are Here Now is an interactive photographic documentation of the personal histories of individuals living in the East and North Ends of Lexington, KY. This project seeks to spotlight individual histories, and to comprehend the ways in which those histories intersect to form a shared history and future.

At the opening reception, we invite those who have ties to the North and East Ends to bring photographs depicting moments of personal history. Photos collected during the opening will become part of the installation’s interactive timeline, which will highlight small fragments of life history that have contributed to each person’s arrival to the East and North Ends.*

Participants are invited to visit the gallery once again at the closing of the show to see how these recorded artifacts combine to depict a diverse Lexington community. At the end of this project, we hope participants will recognize more of the ways in which we are alike, instead of focusing on the biases and stereotypes that divide our community.

*Photos brought to the opening reception will be copied and returned to theirs owners.

Brought to you by CartCoop, a collection of individuals living and working in the East/North End of Lexington. The goal of the cooperative is to learn from established community activists and promote community engagement through creative endeavors. Using the skills and connections learned, the collective will create an artwork that celebrates the history and diversity of our communities.

title: So-Called + Get-Together // Gallery talks and Opening
brief_description: The Bolivar Art Gallery hosts two shows concurrently, both exploring the nature of relationships and space through different lenses.
description:
The Bolivar Art Gallery hosts two shows concurrently, both exploring the nature of relationships and space through different lenses. In the front gallery, FOUR-FOOTED FELLOWS CORRESPONDENCE CLUB, a four-person artist collaborative, creates a site specific installation titled So-Called. In the rear gallery space, artist Eric Conrad mounts Get-Together, an exhibition of soft sculptures in varying scale.

gallery talks: ALL artists will talk in the gallery about their work, Friday, October 6 @noon
reception: Friday, October 6, immediately following gallery talks
exhibition dates: October 6 - November 2, 2017

http://fourfootedfellows.com/
http://www.eric-conrad.com/

title: Jeffrey Wengrofsky Presents 'Secrets of the Heart'
brief_description: Over the past three years, Jeffrey Wengrofsky has produced three film festivals - Secrets of the Insect World, Secrets of the Intoxicated Life, and Secrets of the Heart
description:
The Secrets of the Heart program premiered at the Howl! Happening (NYC) in April 2016. It was next screened at Reverb (Baltimore) in Sept 2016 and then at the Gene Frankel Theatre (NYC) on Valentine's Day 2017. The next program in the series - Secrets of the Deep: Dreams on Film - is accepting submissions through the end of the year on Free Freeway and WithoutaBox. The screening will be at the Gene Frankel Theatre (NYC) in late January 2018.

Isabelle Vossart (France), narrative film, Misery, 2007.

Christoph Rainer (Austria), Requiem For a Robot, narrative film, 2014.

Jennifer Boles (Chicago), Things & Images: The Love Story, documentary, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, 2016.

Lena Marquise (NYC), Self Love Ritual, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, experimental film, 2016.

Leslie Hodgkins (NYC), Treatment, experimental film, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, 2016.

Marie Chauvin (France), Some Call That Love, music video, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, 2016.

Bradley Eros (NYC), Eros C'est Lamour, experimental film, 2008.

Robin Queree (Australia), Life's A Drag, narrative film, 2015.

Jeffrey Wengrofsky (NYC), Getting Out of Bed with Richard Foreman, documentary, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, 2016. Director will be present.

Mike Wilson (NYC). 15, narrative film, premiere at Secrets of the Heart, 2016.

BIO: Over the past three years, Jeffrey Wengrofsky has produced three film festivals - Secrets of the Insect World, Secrets of the Intoxicated Life, and Secrets of the Heart - with one more, Secrets of the Deep: Dreams on Film, in the pipeline for January 2018 in New York City. He has taught at New York University, The New School, Rutgers University, and Berkeley College, and has served on the staff of Aperture Photography Magazine, Coilhouse Magazine, and Constellations: An International Journal of Critical and Democratic Theory. His words have also appeared in the pages of the Berkeley Journal of Sociology and Maximumrocknroll, and, soon, Cold Lips Spoken Word Fashionzine. He is now directing The Song of Hiawatha: A Trip in the American Counterculture, his first feature film. Further illumination will be had here www.humansyndicate.com and www.humanfeaturesfilm.com

title: WRFL presents Queerslang 2017: Born in Flames
brief_description: Lizzie Borden's notorious feminist science fiction film, which addresses racism, classism, sexism, and heterosexism in an alternative United States socialist democracy.
description: WRFL: Queerslang 2017 presents 'Born in Flames' (1983), Lizzie Borden's notorious feminist science fiction film, which addresses racism, classism, sexism, and heterosexism in an alternative United States socialist democracy. Programmed by Emma Friedman-Buchanan.

title: Who Goes There? - Group Art Show
brief_description: Join us on Friday, October 13th for the opening reception of Who Goes There? - a group art show celebrating the monstrous, mysterious, and macabre.
description:
Join us on Friday, October 13th for the opening reception of Who Goes There? - a group art show celebrating the monstrous, mysterious, and macabre.

We've curated an art exhibit featuring over 30 local and regional artists with a focus on the spirit of the Halloween season and all things creepy, spooky and fun. Each artist was asked for their own unique take on this theme, and we can't wait to see the results!

Come celebrate the season with us and this show at the Bread Box Studio Artists gallery space! We will have a variety of food for those attending the show, a festive, Halloween-themed atmosphere, and our friends from West Sixth Brewing will be serving a selection of their beers on-site!

Artists participating include:

title: Renaissance Gala: Lyric Seven Year Anniversary!
venues: The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center
organizers: The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center
brief_description: Our Renaissance Gala on October 21 celebrates seven years since the reopening of The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center
description:
The Harlem Renaissance of the 1920s and beyond was a hugely instrumental period for African American culture. While slavery may have been abolished, taking down the institutional barriers was no easy task. African Americans strove to create a new identity. Not to erase the past, but to use it to make themselves stronger - to create, to convey, to empower.

This creative outpour energized and motivated generations, and eventually laid the foundation for the original Lyric Theatre in 1948. The history cultural hub and regional beacon for African American Kentuckians and beyond is a continued inspiration and influence for our current institution. Much as the poets, musicians, and artists of the Harlem Renaissance, we seek to use our past to invigorate our programming and help us build our mission and create our path.

Our Renaissance Gala on October 21 celebrates seven years since the reopening of The Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center. Seven years of providing our community with the arts, seven years of using our history to diversify and enrich our programming – seven years of working on building something inspiring and lasting.

On this special evening, we look to celebrate the innovators of the Harlem Renaissance with a period perfect night. Join us in your best roaring 20s garb, enjoy live jazz music, dancing, and exquisite cuisine.

Couple and group specials are available on tickets.
Individual - $30
Couples - $55
Family of 4 - $100
Table of 8 - $190

title: Kent Lambert: Reckoning
brief_description: Kent Lambert (Chicago) presents a selection of his videos, including the new Reckoning 4.
description:
Kent Lambert (Chicago) presents a selection of his videos, including the new Reckoning 4.

'In my music and video work, I search for intersections between 1) meditative interrogation of society and self 2) textural and tonal intrigue and beauty 3) absurdist and/or humanist humor and 4) cathartic emotional expression. A primary underlying motivation of my video work is to reflect, critique and ultimately transcend American zeitgeists and my own consumption within them.'

title: Halloween Show!: At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul (1964)
brief_description: On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.'
description:
On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.' The film was programmed by Phill Kisling, who will introduce the show.

At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul is a 1964 Brazilian horror film that is the first instance of the character known as Zé do Caixão or translated to english Coffin Joe. The film starts with an old witch telling us to not watch this evil film, to turn away but together we will not heed her superstitious ramblings! Together we will witness the horrific acts of Zé do Caixão as he searches for the perfect woman to carry on his evil bloodline, in attempt to defy God himself!

title: Thriller - Halloween parade and Wicked Wonders Market
brief_description: More than 30 years after Michael Jackson's groundbreaking video first aired, zombies and the non-dead still come together in downtown Lexington to celebrate Halloween
description:
More than 30 years after Michael Jackson's groundbreaking video first aired, zombies and the non-dead still come together in downtown Lexington to celebrate Halloween by re-creating Thriller.

This event, which has been named a top 10 Halloween destination by USA Today, is brought to you by Lexington Parks & Recreation, Mecca Live Studio and WRFL.

Schedule:
2 – 8 p.m. – Wicked Wonders Art Market, Fifth Third Bank Pavilion
6:30 p.m. – Halloween Variety Show, Robert F. Stephens Courthouse Plaza
8 p.m. – Parade, Main Street from Quality and Mill streets
8:30 p.m. – Thriller


For information about being a zombie in Thriller, auditioning for the roles of MJ and Ola, parade applications and market applications, please visit: https://www.lexingtonky.gov/thriller-and-halloween-parade

title: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets)
brief_description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl.
description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl. The band will be playing an early and a late set. Early set will start promptly at 8pm. Late set will start a little less promptly at 10pm with Emily Hagihara and Her Sounds of Fire. Come to one or all.
